article:
'Fresh Records' was an independent record label, and distributor based in the
United Kingdom. Most popular (and successful) in the latter 1970s, the label
once supported punk groups like The Wall, UK Decay, Play Dead, Family Fodder,
Cuddly Toys, The Dark, Wilko Johnson and Big Hair competed with labels such as
4AD.

The label ran out of cash and went bankrupt in 1982. Staff at the label formed
Jungle Records and bought the rights to the label recordings.

A dance label of the same name began in the UK in 1992, supporting artists such
as Strike and Serious Danger.
